alert.note: Alert for Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued October 23 at 8:49PM MDT until October 24 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow, strong wind gusts, and areas of blowing snow. Several inches of snow have fallen. Additional snow accumulations between 3 and 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...In Montana, Pryor/Northern Bighorn Mountains. In Wyoming, Northeast Bighorn Mountains. * WHEN...Until Noon MDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Whiteout conditions are likely at times and will make travel and back country activities treacherous when combined with heavy wet snow. Travel could be very difficult to impossible on highway 14. Heavy wet snow weighing down trees and power lines, combined with the strong winds, may produce downed trees and power outages.
info.instruction: Persons should consider delaying all travel. If travel is absolutely necessary, drive with extreme caution. Consider taking a winter storm kit along with you, including such items as tire chains, booster cables, flashlight, shovel, blankets and extra clothing. Also take water, a first aid kit, and anything else that would help you survive in case you become stranded.
